long_desc.thetext:
For some reason the StructuredTextEditor is overriding initializeDragAndDrop and installTextDragAndDrop. I am not sure why it is doing this but as an experiment I commented them out and the normal scenario of dragging and dropping a snippet to a JSP page still works using the DnD support of AbstractTextEditor.
I have not tried the scenario presented here because I am not sure how I would hook the example code in so as to test it. But I took a look at the Java editors and none of them override the AbstractTextEditor DnD methods so if this scenario works on a Java editor it would work on an SSE editor if it no longer overrides this methods.
Of course I am not completely comfortable with this change not knowing the original reason for overriding this methods so any insight into why this was done would be useful. For what it is worth this change passes all of our JUnits, but I highly doubt we had any testing the DnD functionality.

As we discussed, we support our own Drag and Drop for read-only regions of text in the editors. Unless there is a way to remove and add Drop Targets on our own, we should continue to override these methods.
I will investigate another solution then.

Created attachment 146952 Fix Patch with Removed Classes
The idea behind this fix was simple. I copied the DnD functionality from AbstractTextEditor into our StructuredTextEditor and then modified it to be sensitive to read-only regions. In doing this I have also enabled the ability to highlight text in a StructuredTextEditor and drag and drop it elsewhere in the editor or another editor.
By copying this functionality from AbstractTextEditor I have rendered ReadOnlyAwareDropTargetAdapter and ExtendedEditorDropTargetAdapter unused. Both of these classes are in an internal package and because we are no longer using them I feel it would be great to remove them. So this patch removes them. I will attach another patch that instead of removing them depreciates them because I know removing code (even that in internal packages) seems to be frowned upon.
I will also be attaching a plugin I wrote to test this with.

Created attachment 146953 Fix Patch with Depreciated Classes
As mentioned in my last comment/patch here is the same patch only instead of removing ReadOnlyAwareDropTargetAdapter and ExtendedEditorDropTargetAdapter they have been depreciated.
As a reminder these classes are in an internal package so I feel we should remove them to clean up our code base to allow for maintainability and clarity.

Created attachment 146954 Drag and Drop Testing Plugin
This is a plugin project that allows for testing of this functionality. It is a combination of the Favorities view created in "Eclipse Plug-ins Third Edition" by Eric Clayberg & Dan Rubel and the drag listener sample code provided by Gottfried.
To use it import the project into your workspace and run your target with workspace plugins enabled. You can then open the "favorites" view. To test the DnD functionality create a document that will use the StructuredTextEditor (such as an XML document) and attempt to DnD items from the favorites view onto the editor. When you do so you should see "The TextTransfer was picked!!" and not a file path. To test that it is read-only sensitive you can attempt to drop an item onto a read-only area in a structured document, it will not drop anything.
I think something we lose with this patch is the Proxy handling and the TransferBuilder. Is there any way that we can just fix the ordering in the ExtendedEditorDropTargetAdapter?
